data.title: List of Nobel laureates in Literature
authors: Contributors to Penny's poetry pages Wiki
data.meta_description: The Nobel Prize in Literature (Swedish: Nobelpriset i litteratur) is awarded annually by the Swedish Academy to authors for outstanding contributions in the field of literature. It is one of the five Nobel Prizes established by the 1895 will of Alfred Nobel, which are awarded for outstanding...
data.text:
Year Laureate CountryTemplate:Ref Language Citation Genre(s) 1901 File:Sully-Prudhomme.jpg Sully Prudhomme Template:Country data France French "in special recognition of his poetic composition, which gives evidence of lofty idealism, artistic perfection and a rare combination of the qualities of both heart and intellect"[8] poetry, essay 1902 File:T-mommsen-2.jpg Theodor Mommsen Template:Country data German Empire German "the greatest living master of the art of historical writing, with special reference to his monumental work, A History of Rome"[9] history, law 1903 File:Björnstjerne Björnson, 1901.jpg Bjørnstjerne Bjørnson Template:Country data Norway Norwegian "as a tribute to his noble, magnificent and versatile poetry, which has always been distinguished by both the freshness of its inspiration and the rare purity of its spirit"[10] poetry, novel, drama 1904 File:Frédéric Mistral by Paul Saïn.jpg Frédéric Mistral Template:Country data France Occitan "in recognition of the fresh originality and true inspiration of his poetic production, which faithfully reflects the natural scenery and native spirit of his people, and, in addition, his significant work as a Provençal philologist"[11] poetry, philology File:José Echegaray y Eizaguirre.jpg José Echegaray Template:Country data Spain Spanish "in recognition of the numerous and brilliant compositions which, in an individual and original manner, have revived the great traditions of the Spanish drama"[11] drama 1905 File:Henryk Sienkiewicz 02.jpg Henryk Sienkiewicz Template:Country data Poland Polish "because of his outstanding merits as an epic writer"[12] novel 1906 File:Carducci.jpg Giosuè Carducci Template:Country data Kingdom of Italy Italian "not only in consideration of his deep learning and critical research, but above all as a tribute to the creative energy, freshness of style, and lyrical force which characterize his poetic masterpieces"[13] poetry 1907 File:Kiplingcropped.jpg Rudyard Kipling United Kingdom English "in consideration of the power of observation, originality of imagination, virility of ideas and remarkable talent for narration which characterize the creations of this world-famous author"[14] novel, short story, poetry 1908 File:Rudolf Christoph Eucken.jpg Rudolf Christoph Eucken Template:Country data German Empire German "in recognition of his earnest search for truth, his penetrating power of thought, his wide range of vision, and the warmth and strength in presentation with which in his numerous works he has vindicated and developed an idealistic philosophy of life"[15] philosophy 1909 File:Selma Lagerlöf.jpg Selma Lagerlöf Template:Country data Sweden Swedish "in appreciation of the lofty idealism, vivid imagination and spiritual perception that characterize her writings"[16] novel, short story 1910 File:Adolf Friedrich Erdmann von Menzel 042.jpg Paul von Heyse Template:Country data German Empire German "as a tribute to the consummate artistry, permeated with idealism, which he has demonstrated during his long productive career as a lyric poet, dramatist, novelist and writer of world-renowned short stories"[17] poetry, drama, novel, short story 1911 File:Maurice Maeterlinck.jpg Maurice Maeterlinck Template:Country data Belgium French "in appreciation of his many-sided literary activities, and especially of his dramatic works, which are distinguished by a wealth of imagination and by a poetic fancy, which reveals, sometimes in the guise of a fairy tale, a deep inspiration, while in a mysterious way they appeal to the readers' own feelings and stimulate their imaginations"[18] drama, poetry, essay 1912 File:Gerhart Hauptmann nobel.jpg Gerhart Hauptmann Template:Country data German Empire German "primarily in recognition of his fruitful, varied and outstanding production in the realm of dramatic art"[19] drama, novel 1913 File:Tagore3.jpg Rabindranath Tagore Template:Country data British India Bengali "because of his profoundly sensitive, fresh and beautiful verse, by which, with consummate skill, he has made his poetic thought, expressed in his own English words, a part of the literature of the West"[20] poetry, novel, drama, short story, music 1914 Not awarded 1915 File:Romain Rolland 1915.jpg Romain Rolland Template:Country data France French "as a tribute to the lofty idealism of his literary production and to the sympathy and love of truth with which he has described different types of human beings"[21] novel 1916 File:Johan Krouthén - Porträtt av Verner von Heidenstam.jpg Verner von Heidenstam Template:Country data Sweden Swedish "in recognition of his significance as the leading representative of a new era in our literature"[22] poetry, novel 1917 File:Karl Gjellerup.jpg Karl Adolph Gjellerup Template:Country data Denmark Danish "for his varied and rich poetry, which is inspired by lofty ideals"[23] poetry File:Henrik Pontoppidan 1917.jpg Henrik Pontoppidan Template:Country data Denmark Danish "for his authentic descriptions of present-day life in Denmark"[23] novel 1918 Not awarded 1919 File:Carl spitteler 1905.jpg Carl Spitteler Template:Country data Switzerland German "in special appreciation of his epic, Olympian Spring"[24] poetry 1920 File:Knut Hamsun.jpeg Knut Hamsun Template:Country data Norway Norwegian "for his monumental work, Growth of the Soil"[25] novel 1921 File:AnatoleFrance.JPG Anatole France Template:Country data France French "in recognition of his brilliant literary achievements, characterized as they are by a nobility of style, a profound human sympathy, grace, and a true Gallic temperament"[26] novel, poetry 1922 File:Jacinto Benavente y Martinez.jpg Jacinto Benavente Template:Country data Spain Spanish "for the happy manner in which he has continued the illustrious traditions of the Spanish drama"[27] drama 1923 File:William Butler Yeat by George Charles Beresford.jpg William Butler Yeats Ireland English "for his always inspired poetry, which in a highly artistic form gives expression to the spirit of a whole nation"[28] poetry 1924 File:Władysław Reymont.jpg Władysław Reymont Template:Country data Poland Polish "for his great national epic, The Peasants"[29] novel 1925 File:George bernard shaw.jpg George Bernard Shaw Ireland English "for his work which is marked by both idealism and humanity, its stimulating satire often being infused with a singular poetic beauty"[30] drama, literary criticism 1926 File:Grazia Deledda 1926.jpg Grazia Deledda Template:Country data Kingdom of Italy Italian "for her idealistically inspired writings which with plastic clarity picture the life on her native island and with depth and sympathy deal with human problems in general"[31] poetry, novel 1927 File:Bergson-Nobel-photo.jpg Henri Bergson Template:Country data France French "in recognition of his rich and vitalizing ideas and the brilliant skill with which they have been presented"[32] philosophy 1928 File:Sigrid Undset crop.jpg Sigrid Undset Template:Country data Norway

(Born in

Template:Country data Denmark) Norwegian "principally for her powerful descriptions of Northern life during the Middle Ages"[33] novel 1929 File:Thomas Mann 1937.jpg Thomas Mann Template:Country data Germany German "principally for his great novel, Buddenbrooks, which has won steadily increased recognition as one of the classic works of contemporary literature"[34] novel, short story, essay 1930 File:Sinclair Lewis 1930.jpg Sinclair Lewis File:US flag 48 stars.svg United States English "for his vigorous and graphic art of description and his ability to create, with wit and humour, new types of characters"[35] novel, short story, drama 1931 File:Erik Axel Karlfeldt.jpg Erik Axel Karlfeldt Template:Country data Sweden Swedish "The poetry of Erik Axel Karlfeldt"[36] poetry 1932 File:John galsworthy.jpg John Galsworthy United Kingdom English "for his distinguished art of narration which takes its highest form in The Forsyte Saga"[37] novel 1933 File:Ivan Bunin 1933.jpg Ivan Bunin Stateless (born in

Template:Country data Russian Empire, living in

Template:Country data France) Russian "for the strict artistry with which he has carried on the classical Russian traditions in prose writing"[38] short story, poetry, novel 1934 File:Luigi Pirandello 1932.jpg Luigi Pirandello Template:Country data Kingdom of Italy Italian "for his bold and ingenious revival of dramatic and scenic art"[39] drama, novel, short story 1935 Not awarded 1936 File:Eugene O'Neill 1936.jpg Eugene O'Neill File:US flag 48 stars.svg United States English "for the power, honesty and deep-felt emotions of his dramatic works, which embody an original concept of tragedy"[40] drama 1937 File:Roger Martin du Gard 1937.jpg Roger Martin du Gard Template:Country data France French "for the artistic power and truth with which he has depicted human conflict as well as some fundamental aspects of contemporary life in his novel cycle Les Thibault"[41] novel 1938 File:Pearl Buck (Nobel).jpg Pearl S. Buck File:US flag 48 stars.svg United States English "for her rich and truly epic descriptions of peasant life in China and for her biographical masterpieces"[42] novel, biography 1939 File:FransEemilSillanpää.jpg Frans Eemil Sillanpää Template:Country data Finland Finnish "for his deep understanding of his country's peasantry and the exquisite art with which he has portrayed their way of life and their relationship with Nature"[43] novel 1940 Not awarded 1941 Not awarded 1942 Not awarded 1943 Not awarded 1944 File:Johannes Vilhelm Jensen 1944.jpg Johannes Vilhelm Jensen Template:Country data Denmark Danish "for the rare strength and fertility of his poetic imagination with which is combined an intellectual curiosity of wide scope and a bold, freshly creative style"[44] poetry 1945 File:Gabriela Mistral-01 cropped.jpg Gabriela Mistral Template:Country data Chile Spanish "for her lyric poetry which, inspired by powerful emotions, has made her name a symbol of the idealistic aspirations of the entire Latin American world"[45] poetry 1946 File:Hermann Hesse 1946.jpg Hermann Hesse Template:Country data Switzerland

(Born in

Template:Country data German Empire) German "for his inspired writings which, while growing in boldness and penetration, exemplify the classical humanitarian ideals and high qualities of style"[46] novel, poetry 1947 File:André Gide.jpg André Gide Template:Country data France French "for his comprehensive and artistically significant writings, in which human problems and conditions have been presented with a fearless love of truth and keen psychological insight"[47] novel, essay 1948 T. S. Eliot United Kingdom

(Born in

USA) English "for his outstanding, pioneer contribution to present-day poetry"[48] poetry 1949 File:William Faulkner 1949.jpg William Faulkner File:US flag 48 stars.svg United States English "for his powerful and artistically unique contribution to the modern American novel"[49] novel, short story 1950 File:Honourable Bertrand Russell.jpg Bertrand Russell United Kingdom English "in recognition of his varied and significant writings in which he champions humanitarian ideals and freedom of thought"[50] philosophy 1951 File:Lagerkvist.jpg Pär Lagerkvist Template:Country data Sweden Swedish "for the artistic vigour and true independence of mind with which he endeavours in his poetry to find answers to the eternal questions confronting mankind"[51] poetry, novel, short story, drama 1952 File:François Mauriac (1932).jpg François Mauriac Template:Country data France French "for the deep spiritual insight and the artistic intensity with which he has in his novels penetrated the drama of human life"[52] novel, short story 1953 File:Churchill portrait NYP 45063.jpg Winston Churchill United Kingdom English "for his mastery of historical and biographical description as well as for brilliant oratory in defending exalted human values"[53] history, essay, memoirs 1954 Ernest Hemingway File:US flag 48 stars.svg United States English "for his mastery of the art of narrative, most recently demonstrated in The Old Man and the Sea, and for the influence that he has exerted on contemporary style"[54] novel, short story, screenplay 1955 File:Halldór Kiljan Laxness 1955.jpg Halldór Laxness Template:Country data Iceland Icelandic "for his vivid epic power which has renewed the great narrative art of Iceland"[55] novel, short story, drama, poetry 1956 File:JRJimenez.JPG Juan Ramón Jiménez Template:Country data Spanish State Spanish "for his lyrical poetry, which in Spanish language constitutes an example of high spirit and artistical purity"[56] poetry 1957 File:Albert Camus, gagnant de prix Nobel, portrait en buste, posé au bureau, faisant face à gauche, cigarette de tabagisme.jpg Albert Camus Template:Country data France French "for his important literary production, which with clear-sighted earnestness illuminates the problems of the human conscience in our times"[57] novel, short story, drama, philosophy, essay 1958 File:Boris Pasternak cropped.jpg Boris Pasternak Template:Country data Soviet Union Russian "for his important achievement both in contemporary lyrical poetry and in the field of the great Russian epic tradition"[58] novel, poetry, translation 1959 File:Salvatore Quasimodo 1959.jpg Salvatore Quasimodo Template:Country data Italy Italian "for his lyrical poetry, which with classical fire expresses the tragic experience of life in our own times"[59] poetry 1960 File:Saint-John Perse 1960.jpg Saint-John Perse Template:Country data France French "for the soaring flight and the evocative imagery of his poetry which in a visionary fashion reflects the conditions of our time"[60] poetry 1961 File:Andric Ivo.jpg Ivo Andrić Template:Country data Yugoslavia Serbo-Croatian

[61]

"for the epic force with which he has traced themes and depicted human destinies drawn from the history of his country"[61] novel, short story 1962 File:JohnSteinbeck crop.JPG John Steinbeck United States English "for his realistic and imaginative writings, combining as they do sympathetic humour and keen social perception"[62] novel, short story, screenplay 1963 File:Giorgos Seferis 1963.jpg Giorgos Seferis Template:Country data Kingdom of Greece

(Born in

Template:Country data Ottoman Empire) Greek "for his eminent lyrical writing, inspired by a deep feeling for the Hellenic world of culture"[63] poetry 1964 File:Jean-Paul Sartre FP.JPG Jean-Paul Sartre Template:Country data France French "for his work which, rich in ideas and filled with the spirit of freedom and the quest for truth, has exerted a far-reaching influence on our age"[64] novel, philosophy, drama, literary criticism, screenplay 1965 File:Sholokhov-1938.jpg Mikhail Sholokhov Template:Country data Soviet Union Russian "for the artistic power and integrity with which, in his epic of the Don, he has given expression to a historic phase in the life of the Russian people"[65] novel 1966 File:Agnon.jpg Shmuel Yosef Agnon Template:Country data Israel

(Born in

Template:Country data Austria-Hungary) Hebrew "for his profoundly characteristic narrative art with motifs from the life of the Jewish people"[66] novel, short story Nelly Sachs Template:Country data Sweden

(Born in

Template:Country data German Empire) German "for her outstanding lyrical and dramatic writing, which interprets Israel's destiny with touching strength"[66] poetry, drama 1967 File:MiguelAngelAsturias.JPG Miguel Ángel Asturias Template:Country data Guatemala Spanish "for his vivid literary achievement, deep-rooted in the national traits and traditions of Indian peoples of Latin America"[67] novel, poetry 1968 File:Yasunari Kawabata 1938.jpg Yasunari Kawabata Template:Country data Japan Japanese "for his narrative mastery, which with great sensibility expresses the essence of the Japanese mind"[68] novel, short story 1969 File:Samuel Beckett, f11.jpg Samuel Beckett Ireland English and French "for his writing, which - in new forms for the novel and drama - in the destitution of modern man acquires its elevation"[69] novel, drama, poetry 1970 File:Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn 1974crop.jpg Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn Template:Country data Soviet Union Russian "for the ethical force with which he has pursued the indispensable traditions of Russian literature"[70] novel 1971 File:Pablo Neruda.jpg Pablo Neruda Template:Country data Chile Spanish "for a poetry that with the action of an elemental force brings alive a continent's destiny and dreams"[71] poetry 1972 File:Bundesarchiv B 145 Bild-F062164-0004, Bonn, Heinrich Böll.jpg Heinrich Böll Template:Country data Germany German "for his writing which through its combination of a broad perspective on his time and a sensitive skill in characterization has contributed to a renewal of German literature"[72] novel, short story 1973 File:Patrick White 1973.jpg Patrick White Australia

(Born in

United Kingdom) English "for an epic and psychological narrative art which has introduced a new continent into literature"[73] novel, short story, drama 1974 File:Eyvind.JPG Eyvind Johnson Template:Country data Sweden Swedish "for a narrative art, farseeing in lands and ages, in the service of freedom"[74] novel File:Harry Martinson.jpg Harry Martinson Template:Country data Sweden Swedish "for writings that catch the dewdrop and reflect the cosmos"[74] poetry, novel, drama 1975 File:Eugenio montale 2.jpg Eugenio Montale Template:Country data Italy Italian "for his distinctive poetry which, with great artistic sensitivity, has interpreted human values under the sign of an outlook on life with no illusions"[75] poetry 1976 File:Saul Bellow, 1990.jpg Saul Bellow United States

(Born in

Canada) English "for the human understanding and subtle analysis of contemporary culture that are combined in his work"[76] novel, short story 1977 File:Vicentealeixandre.jpg Vicente Aleixandre Template:Country data Spanish State Spanish "for a creative poetic writing which illuminates man's condition in the cosmos and in present-day society, at the same time representing the great renewal of the traditions of Spanish poetry between the wars"[77] poetry 1978 File:Isaac Bashevis Singer crop.jpg Isaac Bashevis Singer United States

(Born in

Template:Country data Russian Empire) Yiddish "for his impassioned narrative art which, with roots in a Polish-Jewish cultural tradition, brings universal human conditions to life"[78] novel, short story, memoirs 1979 File:Elytis, Odysseas (1911-1996).jpg Odysseas Elytis Template:Country data Greece Greek "for his poetry, which, against the background of Greek tradition, depicts with sensuous strength and intellectual clear-sightedness modern man's struggle for freedom and creativeness"[79] poetry 1980 Czesław Miłosz Template:Country data Poland

United States Polish "who with uncompromising clear-sightedness voices man's exposed condition in a world of severe conflicts"[80] poetry, essay 1981 File:Elias Canetti 2.jpg Elias Canetti Template:Country data Bulgaria

German "for writings marked by a broad outlook, a wealth of ideas and artistic power"[81] novel, drama, memoirs, essay 1982 File:Gabriel Garcia Marquez.jpg Gabriel García Márquez Template:Country data Colombia Spanish "for his novels and short stories, in which the fantastic and the realistic are combined in a richly composed world of imagination, reflecting a continent's life and conflicts"[82] novel, short story, screenplay 1983 William Golding United Kingdom English "for his novels which, with the perspicuity of realistic narrative art and the diversity and universality of myth, illuminate the human condition in the world of today"[83] novel, poetry, drama 1984 File:Jaroslav Seifert grave at Kralupy nad Vltavou cemetery CZ 0008.jpg Jaroslav Seifert Template:Country data Czechoslovakia

(Born in

Template:Country data Austria-Hungary) Czech "for his poetry which endowed with freshness, and rich inventiveness provides a liberating image of the indomitable spirit and versatility of man"[84] poetry 1985 File:No image.svg Claude Simon Template:Country data France French "who in his novel combines the poet's and the painter's creativeness with a deepened awareness of time in the depiction of the human condition"[85] novel 1986 Wole Soyinka Template:Country data Nigeria English "who in a wide cultural perspective and with poetic overtones fashions the drama of existence"[86] drama, novel, poetry 1987 File:Josef Brodsky crop.jpg Joseph Brodsky United States

(Born in

Template:Country data Soviet Union) English and Russian "for an all-embracing authorship, imbued with clarity of thought and poetic intensity"[87] poetry 1988 File:Necip Mahfuz.jpg Naguib Mahfouz Template:Country data Egypt Arabic "who, through works rich in nuance - now clear-sightedly realistic, now evocatively ambiguous - has formed an Arabian narrative art that applies to all mankind"[88] novel 1989 File:Camilo José Cela, Miami Book Fair International, 1994.jpg Camilo José Cela Template:Country data Spain Spanish "for a rich and intensive prose, which with restrained compassion forms a challenging vision of man's vulnerability"[89] novel, short story 1990 File:Paz0.jpg Octavio Paz Template:Country data Mexico Spanish "for impassioned writing with wide horizons, characterized by sensuous intelligence and humanistic integrity"[90] poetry, essay 1991 File:Nadine Gordimer 01.JPG Nadine Gordimer File:Flag of South Africa 1928-1994.svg South Africa English "who through her magnificent epic writing has - in the words of Alfred Nobel - been of very great benefit to humanity"[91] novel, short story, essay 1992 Derek Walcott Template:Country data Saint Lucia English "for a poetic oeuvre of great luminosity, sustained by a historical vision, the outcome of a multicultural commitment"[92] poetry 1993 File:Toni Morrison 2008-2.jpg Toni Morrison United States English "who in novels characterized by visionary force and poetic import, gives life to an essential aspect of American reality"[93] novel 1994 File:Oe Kenzaburo 1-2.jpg Kenzaburō Ōe Template:Country data Japan Japanese "who with poetic force creates an imagined world, where life and myth condense to form a disconcerting picture of the human predicament today"[94] novel, short story 1998 File:JSJoseSaramago.jpg José Saramago Template:Country data Portugal Portuguese "who with parables sustained by imagination, compassion and irony continually enables us once again to apprehend an elusory reality"[98] novel, drama, poetry 1999 File:Grass.JPG Günter Grass Template:Country data Germany German "whose frolicsome black fables portray the forgotten face of history"[99] novel, drama, poetry 2000 File:Gao Xingjian.jpg Gao Xingjian Template:Country data France (since 1998)

Template:Country data China (1940-1998) Chinese "for an oeuvre of universal validity, bitter insights and linguistic ingenuity, which has opened new paths for the Chinese novel and drama"[100] novel, drama, literary criticism 2001 File:No image.svg V. S. Naipaul United Kingdom

(Born in

Template:Country data Trinidad & Tobago) English "for having united perceptive narrative and incorruptible scrutiny in works that compel us to see the presence of suppressed histories"[101] novel, essay 2002 File:Imre Kertész (1929-) Hungarian writer II. by Csaba Segesvári.JPG Imre Kertész Template:Country data Hungary Hungarian "for writing that upholds the fragile experience of the individual against the barbaric arbitrariness of history"[102] novel 2003 File:J.M. Coetzee.JPG J. M. Coetzee South Africa English "who in innumerable guises portrays the surprising involvement of the outsider"[103] novel, essay, translation 2004 File:Elfriede jelinek 2004 small.jpg Elfriede Jelinek Template:Country data Austria German "for her musical flow of voices and counter-voices in novels and plays that with extraordinary linguistic zeal reveal the absurdity of society's clichés and their subjugating power"[104] novel, drama 2005 File:Pinterfoto cropped2.jpg Harold Pinter United Kingdom English "who in his plays uncovers the precipice under everyday prattle and forces entry into oppression's closed rooms"[105] drama 2006 File:Orhan Pamuk 2009 Shankbone.jpg Orhan Pamuk Template:Country data Turkey Turkish "who in the quest for the melancholic soul of his native city has discovered new symbols for the clash and interlacing of cultures"[106] novel, screenplay, essay 2007 File:Doris lessing 20060312 (square).jpg Doris Lessing United Kingdom English "that epicist of the female experience, who with scepticism, fire and visionary power has subjected a divided civilisation to scrutiny"[107] novel, drama, poetry, short story, memoirs 2008 File:Jean-Marie Gustave Le Clézio-press conference Dec 06th, 2008-2.jpg J. M. G. Le Clézio Template:Country data France

Template:Country data Mauritius French "author of new departures, poetic adventure and sensual ecstasy, explorer of a humanity beyond and below the reigning civilization"[108] novel, short story, essay, translation 2009 File:Herta Müller 1.jpg Herta Müller Template:Country data Germany

(Born in

Template:Country data Romania) German "who, with the concentration of poetry and the frankness of prose, depicts the landscape of the dispossessed"[109] novel, poetry 2010 File:Vargas Losa Göteborg Book Fair 2011b.jpg Mario Vargas Llosa File:Flag of Peru (state).svg Peru

Template:Country data Spain Spanish "for his cartography of structures of power and his trenchant images of the individual's resistance, revolt, and defeat".[110] novel, short story, essay, drama 2011 Tomas Tranströmer Template:Country data Sweden Swedish "because, through his condensed, translucent images, he gives us fresh access to reality".[111] poetry, translation 2012 File:MoYan Hamburg 2008.jpg Mo Yan Template:Country data China Chinese "who with hallucinatory realism merges folk tales, history and the contemporary".[112] novel, short story
